meta.explain: Chapter discusses Article 76 of the Industrial Safety and Health Act, which outlines the conditions for ensuring the safety and health of workers. It emphasizes the importance of following the prescribed regulations to protect the well-being of employees in the workplace. The chapter highlights the legal obligations of employers to provide a safe working environment and adhere to safety standards. Overall, it underscores the significance of prioritizing safety and health measures for the welfare of workers.

content.content: Safety and health of workers shall be subject to the conditions as prescribed by the Industrial Safety and Health Act.
